article:
'Variants of [[Cyrillic script|Cyrillic]]' are used by the writing systems of
many languages, especially languages used in the former Soviet Union. The tables
below show the primary sounds represented by the letters in many languages â see
the articles on the languages for more detail. The highlighted letters are those
of the basic Cyrillic alphabet (the original Cyrillic alphabet without the
letters no longer used by any language).

{| class="IPA wikitable" style="text-align:center;text-align:center;table-
layout:fixed"
|+Usage of letters in various languages -
! style="width:6em"|Language families colspan="7" style="width:17.5em"|Slavic
! languages colspan="3" style="width:7.5em"|Other Indo-European colspan="6"
! style="width:12.5em"|Uralic colspan="3" style="width:7.5em"|Caucasian
